page.title: 15FARMER'S VIEW, NORTH STOKE
page.content: North Stoke lies one kilometre from Amberley station, along a cul-de-sac road. Houses, sheds, barns and machin- ery are scattered at random along its one road, culminating in the farm and church (one service monthly). This farm is owned by a Limited Company and run by a tenant farmer. The pressure is on to isolate this village further. "The trains from Amberley have been halved; bus services suspended; the school bus withdrawn. We have no gas or shop. Sanitation is by septic tank. Water is pumped from wells electric- ally. We grow our own vegetables, collect wood or buy coal. There are no amenities in this village. A car is vital for any of us, old and young to attend any social function. Beautiful it may be, but I'm leaving farming to go teaching at Shoreham. It's too cut off here."
